intro: Ferula fontqueri, commonly known as the desert cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
